TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed WebBrowser extends System.Windows.Interop.ActiveXHost

Docs.summary: Hosts and navigates between HTML documents. Enables interoperability between WPF managed code and HTML script.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the document being navigated to has finished downloading.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Navigated event handlers are passed an instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationEventArgs> class, which provides contextual information about the navigation, including Web response details.
This event will only be fired for top-level navigations.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Navigate(string source) cil managed

Docs.summary: Navigates asynchronously to the document at the specified URL.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.WebBrowser.Navigate%28System.String%29> method to navigate to a URL that may include escape characters. Use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.WebBrowser.Navigate%28System.Uri%29> method to navigate to a <xref:System.Uri> that does not include escape characters.

Docs.summary: Navigates asynchronously to the document at the specified URL and specify the target frame to load the document's content into. Additional HTTP POST data and HTTP headers can be sent to the server as part of the navigation request.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.WebBrowser.Navigate%28System.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.Byte%5B%5D%2CSystem.String%29> method to navigate to a URL that may include escape characters. Use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.WebBrowser.Navigate%28System.Uri%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.Byte%5B%5D%2CSystem.String%29> method to navigate to a <xref:System.Uri> that does not include escape characters.

Docs.summary: Occurs just before navigation to a document.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Navigating event handlers are passed an instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigatingCancelEventArgs> class. You can cancel the navigation by setting the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigatingCancelEventArgs> object to `true`.
This event will only be fired for top-level navigations.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an instance of a public class, implemented by the host application, that can be accessed by script from a hosted document.
Docs.value: The that is an instance of a class, implemented by the host application, that can be accessed by script from a hosted document.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property can be set to any COM-visible object for which you want its public properties and methods available to scripting code. You can make a class COM-visible by marking it with the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisibleAttribute>.
The object that is set for scripting is exposed to the current document by the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_html](~/includes/tla2sharptla-html-md.md)] DOM using the `window.external` property.

Docs.exception: is set with an instance of type that is not .

Docs.summary: Reloads the current page.
Docs.exception: The instance is no longer valid.
A reference to the underlying native WebBrowser could not be retrieved.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Refresh(bool noCache) cil managed

Docs.param: Specifies whether to refresh without cache validation.
Docs.summary: Reloads the current page with optional cache validation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If `noCache` is `true`, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.WebBrowser> control refreshes without cache validation by sending a "Pragma:no-cache" header to the server.

Docs.exception: The instance is no longer valid.
A reference to the underlying native WebBrowser could not be retrieved.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the of the current document hosted in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting the source property causes <xref:System.Windows.Controls.WebBrowser> to navigate to the document specified by the <xref:System.Uri>. If the <xref:System.Uri> is `null`, a blank document is displayed ("about:blank").
## Examples The following example shows how to configure <xref:System.Windows.Controls.WebBrowser> to navigate to an [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_html](~/includes/tla2sharptla-html-md.md)] document by using markup only.
```xaml <!-- Web Browser Control that hosts a web page. --> <WebBrowser x:Name="webBrowser" Source="http://msdn.com" Width="600" Height="600" /> ```
